sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: What is the volume of a sphere that has a radius of 5 cm?
message_2:
The volume V of a sphere can be calculated using the formula:

V = (4/3)πr³

where r is the radius of the sphere.

Given that the radius of the sphere is 5 cm, we can plug this value into the formula:

V = (4/3)π(5)³

V = (4/3)π(125)

V = (500/3)π

V ≈ 523.6 cubic centimeters

The volume of the sphere with a radius of 5 cm is approximately 523.6 cubic centimeters.
